statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: BYU 74, Long Beach St. 34
article.story: LONG BEACH, Calif. (AP) -- Lee Cummard scored 15 points and Trent Plaisted added 12 as BYU trounced Long Beach State 74-34 in the season opener for both teams Saturday. The Cougars, the 2006 Mountain West Conference champions, controlled the game from the start and spoiled the debut of 49ers new coach Dan Monson. Cummard made 6 of 12 shots and had 9 rebounds in 33 minutes. The Cougars shot 43.5 percent for the game (27-for-62) and outrebounded the 49ers 55-40. Long Beach State, the defending Big West champions, shot just 19.1 percent, including 2-for-22 from behind the arc. In the teams' first meeting since 1985, the Cougars started the game with a 10-0 run, then midway through the first half made four consecutive 3-pointers and increased their lead to 29-4 on a 3 by Jimmer Fredette with 6:24 remaining in the half. Long Beach State never got closer than 22 points the rest of the way and ended up losing by 40. The young 49ers, who do not have a senior on their roster, shot only 3-for-27 in the first half, missed all 11 3-point attempts, and were outrebounded 28-19. BYU led at halftime 36-12. Andrew Fleming scored 11 points and Donovan Morris had 10 rebounds to lead Long Beach State. Jonathan Tavernari had 9 rebounds for the Cougars.
